name: Groundwater (amount per unit area)
description: Amount of water present beneath the ground surface per unit area.

name: Groundwater level
description: Elevation of the water table or piezometric surface of an aquifer at a certain location and time. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Lake area
description: Area extent of the surface of a lake.

name: Lake level
description: Elevation of water in an inland body of surface water of significant extent. [Based on 'water level' and 'lake' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Stream discharge
description: Volume of water flowing through a stream (or channel) cross-section per unit time. [Based on 'discharge' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Stream level
description: Elevation of the free water surface of a water body flowing in an open or closed conduit. [Based on 'water level'and 'stream' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Coastlines
description: Location of coastlines (Lat/Long)

name: Land cover
description: Processed from land surface imagery by assigning identified cluster(s) within a given area to specific classes of objects - Accuracy expressed as number of classes. Actually [ classes-1 ] is used, so that smaller figure corresponds to better performance, as usual.

name: Land surface topography
description: Map of land surface heights.

name: Wetland extent
description: Fraction of an area flood by water.

name: Soil type
description: Result of the classification of different types of soil within an area - Accuracy expressed as inverse of the number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.

name: Fire fractional cover
description: Fraction of a land area where fire is occurring.

name: Fire radiative power
description: Power radiated by the fire occurring within an area.

name: Fire temperature
description: Temperature of the fire occurring within an area.

name: Land surface temperature
description: Temperature of the apparent surface of land (bare soil or vegetation).

name: Lake Surface Temperature
description: Temperature of the lake surface.

name: CO2 flux
description: Flux of carbon dioxide from the surface to the atmosphere

name: Biomass
description: Total amount of vegetation in a reference area

name: Fraction of vegetated land
description: Fraction of a land area where vegetation is present.

name: Leaf Area Index (LAI)
description: LAI (Leaf Area Index, LAI) is the total one-sided area of photosynthetic tissue per unit ground surface area.

name: Normalised Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI)
description: Difference between maximum (in NIR) and minimum (around the Red) vegetation reflectance, normalised to the summation. Representative of total biomass, supportive for computing LAI if not directly measured.

name: Vegetation type
description: Result of the classification of different types of vegetation within a vegetated area - Accuracy expressed as inverse of the number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.

name: Evaporation
description: Quantity of water evaporated from the soil and plants when the ground is at its natural moisture content.

name: Soil moisture (in the roots region)
description: Fractional content of water in a volume of wet soil. Typically in a layer from the surface down to approximately 3 meters.

name: Soil moisture at surface
description: Fractional content of water in a volume of wet soil. Surface layer (upper few centimetres).

name: Fraction of Absorbed PAR (FAPAR)
description: Fraction of PAR absorbed by vegetation (land or marine) for photosynthesis processes (generally around the 'red' frequencies).

name: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR)
description: Flux of downwelling photons of wavelength 400-700 nm.

name: Soil temperature
description: The standard depths for soil temperature measurements are 5, 10, 20, 50 and 100 cm below the surface; additional depths may be included. The site for such measurements should be a level plot of bare ground (about 75 cm^2 ) and typical of the surrounding soil for which information is required.

name: Glacier motion
description: Velocity of the ice measured at the surface of a glacier.

name: Glacier topography
description: Map of the height of the glacier surface.

name: Ice sheet topography
description: Map of ice sheet height over land.

name: Depth of snowfall
description: The vertical depth of freshly fallen snow that has accumulated during a specific period.

name: Snow cover extent
description: The area of snow-covered ground, ice, or firn based on the fractional threshold used to define presence of snow.

name: Snow depth
description: Vertical distance from the snow surface to a stated reference level.

name: Snow surface state
description: Binary product (dry or wet) expressing the presence of liquid water at the surface of the snow cover.

name: Water equivalent of snow cover
description: The Vertical depth of the water that would be obtained if the snow cover melted completely, which equates to the snow-cover mass per unit area.

name: Presence of snow
description: A binary observation of the presence of snow cover at the measurement location.

name: Water equivalent of snowfall
description: Vertical depth of the water that would be obtained if the freshly fallen snow melted completely, which equates to the new snow mass per unit area.

name: Glacier mass balance at a point
description: The result of all processes adding and removing mass from the glacier at a point on its surface, expressed over a stated period of time

name: Glacier-wide mass balance
description: The result of all processes adding and removing mass from the glacier at its surface, expressed over a stated period of time and integrated over the entire glacier area

name: Surface accumulation at a point
description: The mass added to the glacier at a point on its surface expressed over a stated period of time.

name: Surface ablation at a point
description: The mass removed from the glacier at a point on its surface expressed over a stated period of time.

name: Glacier area
description: Area enclosed by the projection of the glacier outline onto the surface of an ellipsoid approximating the surface of the Earth or onto a planar horizontal approximation to that ellipsoid. The glacier area excludes nunataks but includes debris-covered parts of the glacier. The glacier outline separates the glacier from unglacierized terrain and from contiguous glaciers.

name: Permafrost temperature
description: Ground temperature measured in the permafrost.

name: Active layer thickness
description: Thickness of the surface layer of the ground that is subject to annual thawing and freezing in areas underlain by permafrost.

name: Rock glacier velocity
description: Surface velocity of a single rock glacier unit.

name: Stream velocity
description: Ratio of the distance covered by a body of water, moving in a specified direction, to the time taken to cover that distance. [Based on 'velocity' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Stream mean velocity
description: Velocity at a given cross-section of a stream, obtained by dividing the discharge by the cross-sectional area of the stream at that section. [Based on 'mean velocity' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Stream surface velocity
description: Velocity of a stream at its surface at a given point. [Based on 'surface velocity' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Water surface slope
description: Difference in the stage of water surface over a short stream reach. [Based on 'water surface slope' in Manual on Stream Gauging (WMO-No. 1044), Volume II. 2010.]

name: Water level
description: Elevation of the free water surface of a water body relative to a reference datum (synonym: stage, gage height). [Based on 'water level' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Percolation rate
description: Flow of a liquid through an unsaturated porous medium, such as that of water in soil under the effect of gravity for a unit time. [Based on 'percolation' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Recharge rate
description: Natural or artificial introduction of water into the saturated zone of an aquifer for a unit time. [Based on 'groundwater recharge' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Aquifer volume
description: Volume of geological formation capable of storing, transmitting and yielding exploitable quantities of water. [Based on 'aquifer' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Hydraulic conductivity
description: Property of a porous medium or fractured rock which, according to Darcy's law, relates the specific discharge to the hydraulic gradient. [based on 'hydraulic conductivity' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Hydraulic transmissivity
description: Rate at which water is transferred through a unit width of an aquifer under a unit hydraulic gradient. [Based on 'transmissivity' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Porosity
description: Ratio of the volume of the interstices in a given sample of a porous medium to the gross volume of the sample, inclusive of voids. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Effective porosity
description: Volume of the void spaces through which water or other fluids can travel in rock or sediment, divided by the total volume of the rock or sediment. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Specific retention
description: Amount of water held in the soil after gravitational water has drained away expressed as a volume percentage. [Based on 'specific retention' and 'field capacity' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Infiltration rate
description: Flow of water through the soil surface into a porous medium for a unit time. [Based on 'infiltration' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Infiltration capacity
description: Maximum rate at which water can penetrate the soil matrix per unit area under certain conditions. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Specific capacity (well)
description: Ratio of discharge of a well to drawdown at equilibrium. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Specific yield
description: Ratio of the volume of water which can be drained by gravity from an initially saturated porous medium to the total volume of the porous medium. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Groundwater flow
description: Volume of groundwater flowing through an aquifer per unit time. [Based on International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Storage
description: (1) Impounding of water in surface or underground reservoirs for future use. (2) Volume of water stored. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Total dissolved solids
description: The concentration of all dissolved substances in water, usually expressed in milligrams per litre, which would remain as a solid residue after removal of the water. [Manual on Water Quality Monitoring (WMO-No. 680). 1988]

name: Suspended sediment
description: The component of an unacidified water sample that is retained by a 0.45-nm membrane filter. [Manual on Water Quality Monitoring (WMO-No. 680). 1988]

name: Sediment discharge
description: Rate of movement of sediments in a stream at a given cross-section. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Bed load discharge
description: Amount (weight, mass or volume) of sediment that moves on or near the streambed by rolling, sliding, or saltating (bed load) transported through a cross-section of a stream per unit time. [Based on 'bed load discharge' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Suspended sediment load
description: That part of the total transported sediment which is suspended by turbulence in the flowing water for considerable periods of time without contact with the stream bed, moving with almost the same velocity as the flowing water and generally expressed in mass or volume per unit of time. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Total sediment load
description: Total quantity of sediment passing through a reach, both in suspension and along the bed, excluding the sediment deposited on the bed within the reach. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Runoff
description: That part of the precipitation which flows on the ground surface (surface runoff) or within the soil (subsurface runoff or interflow) and is generally expressed in mass or volume per unit of time, its equivalent in linear units (as the height of a water layer covering a given area) or as a fraction of precipitation. [Based on International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Runoff coefficient
description: Ratio of runoff depth to precipitation depth. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Depth of runoff
description: Runoff volume from a drainage basin, divided by its area, in a specified time. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Soil moisture
description: Percentage of water in soil expressed relative to dry-soil weight or by volume.Synonym: water content of soil. [Based on 'soil moisture content' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Live storage
description: Volume of water in a reservoir between the minimum and maximum water levels under normal operating conditions. Synonyms: usable storage, active storage, available storage capacity. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Reservoir storage
description: Volume of a reservoir including dead storage. Synonym: total storage. [Based on 'total storage' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Lake volume
description: Volume of water contained in a lake at a given water level. [International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Suspended sediment discharge
description: Amount of suspended sediment (suspended by turbulence for considerable periods of time without contact with the bed) crossing a stream section per unit time.  [Based on 'suspended sediment' in International Glossary of Hydrology (WMO-No. 385). 2012 edition.]

name: Stream index velocity
description: A velocity that is representative of the average stream velocity; often measured in a profile or across the stream or over the water surface. [Based on 'velocity index method' in Manual on Stream Gauging (WMO-No. 1044), Volume II. 2010]
